module.p:
Examples from Gairm –
[...] ’S bha iad ’nan suidhe an sin ag òl uisge-beatha fad na h-oidhch’, na ceathrar aca. An dràsda ’s a rithist shealladh Iain a-mach air an uinneig ris a’ mhuir ’s na h-eileanan. [...]
[...] And they were sat there drinking whisky all night, the four of them. Now and again John would look out the window at the sea and the islands. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn

Some examples –
older pedagogical examples –
Bha an latha brèagha blàth is thug an athair leis Iain agus Anna anns a’ chàr. Chaidh iad sìos taobh an locha is stad iad aig àite bòidheach gorm. Chuir iad an càr a stigh gu taobh an rathaid is thug iad brat a mach as a’ chàr air son suidhe air. [...]
The day was lovely and warm and their father took John and Ann in the car. They went down the side of the lake and they stopped at a beautiful green place. They put the car into the side of the road and they took a blanket out of the car for sitting on. [...] td. 6

module.p:
Corpus examples –
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. Cuin a chualas ball-Pàrlamaid a’ togail a ghuth a dh’ iarraidh leasachaidh do staid Gàidhlig ann an Albainn? Am bi cothrom a nis aig cuideigin a ghuth a thogail, anns an t-suidheachadh iongantach a th’ againn anns a’ Phàrlamaid ùr?
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. When has a member of Parliament been heard raising his voice to demand improvement for the state of Gaelic in Scotland? Will someone have an opportunity now to raise his voice, in the unexpected situation we have in the new Parliament? td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
